      int removeEdge​(java.lang.String src, java.lang.String dst)
      Removes an edge between a source and the destination node, and if either the source or the destination node is the ego the alter node is removed from the social graph too (because the condition for which a node belongs to the ego network, that is only if it is connected to the ego with an edge, isn't satisfied anymore)

      • totalHourActive

        private long totalHourActive
        Total number of hours the context has been active

      • timeCounter

        private long[][] timeCounter
        Counter of the times the context has been active during the week. It is useful to determine the temporal slots in which the context is recurrently active (i.e. reccurring days of the week, recurring hours during a specific day of the week) It is updated every time the context is unloaded N.B. timeCounter[0] represents sunday

      • tempDayOfWeek

        private int tempDayOfWeek
        Day of the week the context has been loaded

        Hour of the day the context has been laaded

      • addEdge

        public int addEdge​(java.lang.String src,
                   java.lang.String dst)
        Adds an edge between two nodes of the social graph
        Parameters:
        src - The source node's username
        dst - The destination node's username
        Returns:
        -1 if either src or dst isn't a valid user of the context 0 if the operation is successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src or dst are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dst are the same node

      • getNode

        public Node getNode​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets a node given its username
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of the node
        Returns:
        The node that has nodeName as its username (if it exists), null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If nodeName is null

      • addInteraction

        public void addInteraction​(Node src,
                           Node dst,
                           long timestamp,
                           int duration,
                           java.lang.String type)
        Adds an interaction on an edge between two nodes of the context
        Parameters:
        src - The source node of the edge
        dst - The destination node of the edge
        timestamp - The start time of the interaction
        duration - The duration of the interaction
        type - The interactipn type

      • getEdgeWeight

        public java.lang.Double getEdgeWeight​(java.lang.String src,
                                      java.lang.String dst)
        Gets the weight of the edge (if it exists) between two nodes of the social graph
        Parameters:
        src - The source node's username
        dst - The destination node's username
        Returns:
        The weight of the edge if the source and the destination nodes are in the social graph and are connected by an edge, null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src and dest are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dest are the same node

      • getEdgeTimeStamp

        public long getEdgeTimeStamp​(java.lang.String src,
                             java.lang.String dst)
        Gets the creation time of the edge (if it exists) between two nodes of the social graph
        Parameters:
        src - The source node's username
        dst - The destination node's username
        Returns:
        The creation date of the edge if the source and the destination nodes are in the social graph and are connected by an edge, -2 if either the source or the destination do not exist, -1 if the edge doesn't exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src and dest are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dest are the same node

      • removeEdge

        public int removeEdge​(java.lang.String src,
                      java.lang.String dst)
        Removes an edge between a source and the destination node, and if either the source or the destination node is the ego the alter node is removed from the social graph too (because the condition for which a node belongs to the ego network, that is only if it is connected to the ego with an edge, isn't satisfied anymore)
        Parameters:
        src - The source node
        dst - The destination node
        Returns:
        4 if the source and the destionation nodes are the same, 3 if either the source node or the destination node do not exist, 0 if the edge is removed but the alter is not, -1 if both the edge and the alter are removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src and dest are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src and dest are the same node

      • addPerson

        public boolean addPerson​(java.lang.String username,
                         int identifier,
                         java.lang.String firstName,
                         java.lang.String secondName,
                         java.lang.String surname,
                         long birthDate)
        Adds a Person node to the context
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the node
        identifier - Numeric identifier of the node
        firstName - First name of the person
        secondName - Second name of the person
        surname - Surname of the person
        birthDate - Birth date of the user
        Returns:
        True if the Person is added successfully, false otherwise (if the addNode method fails)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if username, firstName, secondName or surName are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userName, firstName or surname are empty strings

      • addSmartObject

        public boolean addSmartObject​(java.lang.String username,
                              long id,
                              java.lang.String macAddr,
                              java.lang.String man,
                              java.lang.String own)
        Adds a Smart object node to the context
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the node
        id - Numeric identifier of the node
        macAddr - MAC Address of the devide
        man - Manufacturer of the device
        own - Name of the owner of the device
        Returns:
        True if the Smart Object is added successfully, false otherwise (if the addNode method fails)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if username, macAddr, man or own are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of macAddr is different than 12, or if man or own are empty strings

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode​(Node newNode)
        Adds a node to the context. A node is added because it has been detected by the application running on the device of the ego. Two edge are thus added (from the ego to the new node and vice versa) to model the new relationship between them.
        Parameters:
        newNode - The new node to be added
        Returns:
        True if the node is added successfully, false if a node with the same username exists or the new node's username corresponds to ego's username
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if newNode is null

      • removeNode

        public boolean removeNode​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Removes a node from the context's social graph
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of the node that has to be removed
        Returns:
        True if successfully removed, false if the node doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If nodeName is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If nodeName is equal to egoName (it is impossible to remove the ego node)

      • getInEdges

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getInEdges​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the in-going edges of a node
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        The out-going edges that have the parameter node as their source, enriched by their tie strength or null if the nodeName doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If nodeName is null

      • getOutEdges

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getOutEdges​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the out-going edges of a node
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        The in-going edges that have the parameter node as their destination, enriched by their tie strength or null if the nodeName doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If nodeName is null

      • getNodeData

        public java.lang.String getNodeData​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the node that corresponds to a username
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        The data associated to that node, or null if it doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If nodeName is null

      • setNodeStringData

        public boolean setNodeStringData​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                 java.lang.String data)
        Associates some String data to a user
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        data - The data to be associated to the user
        Returns:
        True if the operation is successful (the user exists in the context), false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName or data is null

      • setNodeObjectData

        public boolean setNodeObjectData​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                 java.lang.Object data)
        Associates some Object data to a user
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        data - The data to be associated to the user
        Returns:
        True if the operation is successful (the user exists in the context), false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName or data is null

      • setNodeDataClass

        public boolean setNodeDataClass​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                java.lang.String dataClass)
        Sets the class of a user's object data
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of the node
        dataClass - The class to be set
        Returns:
        True if the operation is successful (the user exists in the context), false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName or data is null

      • getNodeDataClass

        public java.lang.String getNodeDataClass​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the class of a user's object data
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        The class of a user's object data, or null if the node doesn't exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null

      • getNodeDataObject

        public java.lang.Object getNodeDataObject​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the a user's object data
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        The user's object data, or null if the node doesn't exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null

      • getNodeStatus

        public int getNodeStatus​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the online status of a node
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of the node
        Returns:
        0 if the user is online, 1 if it is online, -1 if the node doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null

      • setOnline

        public int setOnline​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                     boolean value)
        Updates a user's state to online/offline
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        value - True if the user's state has to be set to online, false otherwise
        Returns:
        0 if the operation is successful, -1 if the user doesn't exist in the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null

      • getScore

        public double getScore​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the score of a user (number of times online divided life span of the node)
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of a node
        Returns:
        -1 if the user doesn't exist in the context, the score of the user in the context otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null

      • removeWeakEdge

        public void removeWeakEdge​(java.lang.String src,
                           java.lang.String dst,
                           double threshold)
        Removes an edge of the context if its tie strength is smaller than a threshold. If the source or the destination of the edge was the ego, the alter node is also removed from the context.
        Parameters:
        src - The username of the source node of the edge
        dst - The username of the destination node of the edge
        threshold - The value that is compared to the tie strength
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if src or dst is null, if there are no nodes having src/dst as their identifier, or if there isn't an edge between the source and the destination node
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if threshold is less than 0

      • removeWeakEdges

        public void removeWeakEdges​(double threshold)
        Removes all the edges of the context whose tie strength is smaller than a threshold.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The value that is compared to the tie strength
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if threshold is less than 0

      • findNodeById

        public Node findNodeById​(java.lang.Integer id)
        Gets a node by its id
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier to be looked for
        Returns:
        The node which has such id, or null if no node has that id
